00024 #ifndef FLAGS_H
00025 #define FLAGS_H
00026 
00027 #ifndef USE_PCH
00028 #include <stdint.h>
00029 #endif
00030 
00031 namespace cwchess {
00032 
00033 /** @brief The POD base type of class Flags.
00034 * 
00035  * @sa Flags, fl_pawn_can_take_queen_side, fl_pawn_is_not_blocked, fl_pawn_can_take_king_side, fl_pawn_can_move_two_squares
00036 * / 
00037 struct FlagsData {
00038   uint8_t M_bits;       //!< 0TKNQ000, T=can move two squares, K=can take king side, N=is not blocked, Q=can take queen side.
00039 };
00040 
00041 FlagsData const fl_none = { 0 };
00042 
00043 uint8_t const fl_pawn_mask = { 120 };
00044 
00045 // Do not change these values, their exact value has a deeper meaning.
00046 FlagsData const fl_pawn_can_take_queen_side = { 8 };    //!< A constant representing the flag 'pawn can take queen side'.
00047 FlagsData const fl_pawn_is_not_blocked = { 16 };        //!< A constant representing the flag 'pawn is not blocked'.
00048 FlagsData const fl_pawn_can_take_king_side = { 32 };    //!< A constant representing the flag 'pawn can take king side'.
00049 FlagsData const fl_pawn_can_move_two_squares = { 64 };  //!< A constant representing the flag 'pawn can move two squares'.
00050 
00051 // Compare constants (this should never be needed, but why not add it).
00052 inline bool operator==(FlagsData f1, FlagsData f2) { return f1.M_bits == f2.M_bits; }
00053 inline bool operator!=(FlagsData f1, FlagsData f2) { return f1.M_bits != f2.M_bits; }
00054 
00055 /** @brief Calculate the union of two Flags constants.* /
00056 inline FlagsData operator|(FlagsData x, FlagsData y)
00057 {
00058   FlagsData result;
00059   result.M_bits = x.M_bits | y.M_bits;
00060   return result;
00061 }
00062 
00063 /** @brief Calculate the intersection of two Flags constants.* /
00064 inline FlagsData operator&(FlagsData x, FlagsData y)
00065 {
00066   FlagsData result;
00067   result.M_bits = x.M_bits & y.M_bits;
00068   return result;
00069 }
00070 
00071 /** @brief Calculate the union minus the intersection of two Flags constants.* /
00072 inline FlagsData operator^(FlagsData x, FlagsData y)
00073 {
00074   FlagsData result;
00075   result.M_bits = x.M_bits ^ y.M_bits;
00076   return result;
00077 }
00078 
00079 /** @brief %Flags representing the state of a piece on the chessboard.
00080 * 
00081  * This class is for internal use. You should not need it.
00082 * 
00083  * @sa FlagsData
00084 * /
00085 class Flags : protected FlagsData {
00086   public:
00087   /** @name Constructors* /
00088   //@{
00089 
00090     //! Construct an uninitialized Flags object.
00091     Flags(void) { }
00092 
00093     //! Copy-constructor.
00094     Flags(Flags const& flags) { M_bits = flags.M_bits; }
00095 
00096     //! Construct a Flags object from a constant.
00097     Flags(FlagsData flags) { M_bits = flags.M_bits; }
00098 
00099   //@}
00100 
00101   /** @name Assignment operators* /
00102   //@{
00103 
00104     //! Assign from another Flags object.
00105     Flags& operator=(Flags const& flags) { M_bits = flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00106 
00107     //! Assign from a constant.
00108     Flags& operator=(FlagsData flags) { M_bits = flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00109 
00110     //! Set all flags to 0.
00111     void clear(void) { M_bits = 0; }
00112 
00113   //@}
00114 
00115   /** @name Comparision operators* /
00116   //@{
00117 
00118     friend bool operator==(Flags const& f1, Flags const& f2) { return f1.M_bits == f2.M_bits; }
00119     friend bool operator==(Flags const& f1, FlagsData f2) { return f1.M_bits == f2.M_bits; }
00120     friend bool operator==(FlagsData f1, Flags const& f2) { return f1.M_bits == f2.M_bits; }
00121     friend bool operator!=(Flags const& f1, Flags const& f2) { return f1.M_bits != f2.M_bits; }
00122     friend bool operator!=(Flags const& f1, FlagsData f2) { return f1.M_bits != f2.M_bits; }
00123     friend bool operator!=(FlagsData f1, Flags const& f2) { return f1.M_bits != f2.M_bits; }
00124 
00125   //@}
00126 
00127   /** @name Bit fiddling* /
00128   //@{
00129 
00130     //! Set all bits that are set in \a flags.
00131     Flags& operator|=(Flags const& flags) { M_bits |= flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00132 
00133     //! Set all bits that are set in \a flags.
00134     Flags& operator|=(FlagsData flags) { M_bits |= flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00135 
00136     //! Reset all bits that are not set in \a flags.
00137     Flags& operator&=(Flags const& flags) { M_bits& = flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00138 
00139     //! Reset all bits that are not set in \a flags.
00140     Flags& operator&=(FlagsData flags) { M_bits& = flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00141 
00142     //! Toggle all bits that are set in \a flags.
00143     Flags& operator^=(Flags const& flags) { M_bits ^= flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00144 
00145     //! Toggle all bits that are set in \a flags.
00146     Flags& operator^=(FlagsData flags) { M_bits ^= flags.M_bits; return* this; }
00147 
00148     //! Set the bits that are set in \a flags.
00149     void set(FlagsData flags) { M_bits |= flags.M_bits; }
00150 
00151     //! Clear the bits that are set in \a flags.
00152     void reset(FlagsData flags) { M_bits& = ~flags.M_bits; }
00153 
00154   //@}
00155 
00156   /** @name Special functions* /
00157   //@{
00158 
00159     //! Set the fl_pawn_can_move_two_squares bit iff fl_pawn_is_not_blocked bit is already set.
00160     void set_can_move_two_squares_if_not_blocked(void) { M_bits |= (M_bits & 16) << 2; }
00161 
00162   //@}
00163 
00164   /** @name Accessors* /
00165   //@{
00166 
00167     //! Return the underlaying integral value.
00168     uint8_t operator()(void) const { return M_bits; }
00169 
00170   //@}
00171 
00172 };
00173 
00174 } // namespace cwchess
00175 
00176 #endif  // FLAGS_H
